issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Stumbled upon this problem while refreshing queues with incorrect configuration. The exact scenario was:
1. Added a new queue "newQueue" without defining its capacity.
2. "bin/mapred queue -refreshQueues" fails correctly with "Illegal capacity of -1 for queue root.newQueue"
3. However, after defining the capacity of "newQueue" followed by a second "bin/mapred queue -refreshQueues" throws "org.apache.hadoop.metrics2.MetricsException: Metrics source QueueMetrics,q0=root,q1=newQueue already exists!" Also see Hadoop:name=QueueMetrics,q0=root,q1=newQueue,service=ResourceManager metrics being available even though the queue was not added.

The expected behavior would be to refresh the queues correctly and allow addition of "newQueue".
fields.summary: Failed refreshQueues due to misconfiguration prevents further refreshing of queues

comments.body: Sorry, I meant "bin/yarn rmadmin -refreshQueues" instead of "bin/mapred queue -refreshQueues" in all the above commands.

A more thorough fix will need a major re-work of MetricsSystem, for now I've worked around by adding a cache in QueueMetrics.

Ready for review/commit.

+1 with minor change to remove extra "ms.start()" from TestQueueMetrics

Thanks Arun!

Integrated in Hadoop-Hdfs-trunk-Commit #2668 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-Hdfs-trunk-Commit/2668/])
    YARN-27. Failed refreshQueues due to misconfiguration prevents further refreshing of queues (Arun Murthy via tgraves) (Revision 1375066)

     Result = SUCCESS
